swerve.drive

Class SwerveDrive

  • java.lang.Object
    • RobotDriveBase
      • swerve.drive.SwerveDrive
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    FESwerveDrive

    public class SwerveDrive
extends RobotDriveBase
    Utilizes SwerveWheel subsystems to create a singular, easy-to-use swerve drive.

    • Constructor Detail

      • SwerveDrive

        public SwerveDrive(SwerveWheel _flWheel,
                   SwerveWheel _frWheel,
                   SwerveWheel _rlWheel,
                   SwerveWheel _rrWheel)
        Creates a new SwerveDrive given SwerveWheel wheels. Note: SwerveDrive(SwerveWheel, SwerveWheel, SwerveWheel, SwerveWheel, double) should be used instead if the wheelbase and track are not equal.
        Parameters:
        _flWheel - The front left SwerveWheel
        _frWheel - The front right SwerveWheel
        _rlWheel - The rear left SwerveWheel
        _rrWheel - The rear right SwerveWheel

      • SwerveDrive

        public SwerveDrive(SwerveWheel _flWheel,
                   SwerveWheel _frWheel,
                   SwerveWheel _rlWheel,
                   SwerveWheel _rrWheel,
                   double _widthToHeightRatio)
        Creates a new SwerveDrive given SwerveWheel wheels.
        Parameters:
        _flWheel - The front left SwerveWheel
        _frWheel - The front right SwerveWheel
        _rlWheel - The rear left SwerveWheel
        _rrWheel - The rear right SwerveWheel
        _widthToHeightRatio - The ratio from the track to the wheelbase (the distance between the centers of the front or back wheels divided by the distance between the centers of the left or right wheels). SwerveDrive(SwerveWheel, SwerveWheel, SwerveWheel, SwerveWheel) is recommended if this ratio is 1:1.

    • Method Detail

      • steerAndDrive

        public void steerAndDrive(double strafeX,
                          double strafeY,
                          double steering)
        Drives the SwerveDrive given strafing and steering inputs, all on the interval [-1, 1], where +y is forwards and +x is to the right.
        Parameters:
        strafeX - The strafing speed in the x direction
        strafeY - The strafing speed in the y direction
        steering - The steering speed, where a positive value steers clockwise from a top-down point of view

      • steerAndDriveAll

        public void steerAndDriveAll(double targetDirection,
                             double speed)
        Steers and drives all wheels in the same direction and with the same speed. targetDirection must be on the interval [0, 360), where 0 represents steering directly forwards and an increase represents steering further clockwise. speed must be on the interval [0, 1], where 1 represents directly forwards and -1 represents directly backwards.
        Parameters:
        targetDirection -
        speed -

      • stopMotor

        public void stopMotor()
        Stops all modules immediately.

        public java.lang.String getDescription()
